title: Pep Guardiola admits Manchester City title chances are OVER after Everton thumping
text:
Sport Pep Guardiola admits Manchester City title chances are OVER after Everton thumping The Spaniard's side were embarrassed 4-0 at Goodison Park on Sunday. leaving them 10 points behind Premier League leaders Chelsea Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now   
Pep Guardiola admits Manchester City's title chance are over after being thumped 4-0 by Everton on Sunday. 
The Spaniard suffered the biggest league defeat of his career, as Romelu Lukaku, Kevin Mirallas, Tom Davies and Ademola Lookman all found the net, on a dismal afternoon for City. 
Their capitulation leaves City 10 points behind league leaders Chelsea, who won at Leicester on Saturday. 
And now Guardiola has conceded that winning the title in his maiden season at the Etihad is now beyond his side. (Photo: REUTERS) 
When questioned on whether the gap is now too great for his side to overcome, Guardiola said: "Yes. Ten points is a lot of points. The second one is three points. We have to see. 
"I spoke with my players in the last three weeks or more, [and said], 'Forget about the table, focus on the next game and try to do our best to win'. 
"After that, at the end of the season, we our going to evaluate our level and how our performance was, how the coach was, how the players were. After that we are going to decide [on the future]." A dejected Raheem Sterling (Photo: Alex Livesey) 
Guardiola won titles in his first season with both Barcelona and Bayern Munich. 
But City have now lost five Premier League games already and Guardiola was asked whether he is in the midst of the toughest challenge of his career - something he denies. 
"No. I would say the exceptional situation was in the past. When you have eight years as a coach and you win seven titles and you're always winning - that is the exceptional situation. 
"I have to look for the best solution to take the players to winning games again." Guardiola is doing things his way (Photo: Arfa Griffiths) 
Guardiola insisted he is enjoying life in English football however. 
"I'm so happy in Manchester," he comtinued. "Of course, I prefer to win than to lose but I'm so happy. 
"The way I will try to do it, until my last day, is to find the best way possible to achieve what I think is the best way to play." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
